H0.text: Who was the German mathematician who developed differential calculus independently of Newton in 1675. Johann Bernoulli

H1.text: Who was the German mathematician who developed differential calculus independently of Newton in 1675. Ehrenfried Walther von Tschirnhaus

H2.text: Who was the German mathematician who developed differential calculus independently of Newton in 1675. Jakob Bernoulli

H3.text: Who was the German mathematician who developed differential calculus independently of Newton in 1675. Liebniz

A4.text: According to Leibniz's notebooks, a critical breakthrough occurred on 11 November 1675, when he employed integral calculus for the first time to find the area under the graph of a function y = f(x).

A5.text: Leibniz expressed the inverse relation of integration and differentiation, later called the fundamental theorem of calculus, by means of a figure in his 1693 paper Supplementum geometriae dimensoriae.
